SIPPS is a program developed & run primarily by graduate students, postdocs, and staff in Columbia's Psychology Department.

## Program Directors

<br>
<div class="row">
<div class="col-sm-2">
<p style="text-align:center;"><img src="/images/ana.jpg" style="border:1px solid #A9A9A9"></p>
</div>
<div class="col-sm-4">
<u><b>Ana DiGiovanni</b></u> is a PhD student in the Couples Lab. She studies social support processes and interpersonal emotion regulation strategies (i.e., co-rumination) that occur in close relationships (e.g., romantic relationships, friendships), especially during times of stress.
<p> <img src="/images/email.png" class="icon"> [email](mailto:amd2323@columbia.edu){target="_blank"}
</div>
<div class="col-sm-2">
<p style="text-align:center;"><img src="/images/anna.jpg" style="border:1px solid #A9A9A9"></p>
</div>
<div class="col-sm-4">
<u><b>Anna Vannucci</b></u> is a 2nd year PhD student working the DAN Lab. She studies the role that early experiences and affective learning and memory processes play in shaping children's neuro- development, emotional behaviors, and emergence of psychopathology.
<p> <img src="/images/email.png" class="icon"> [email](mailto:av2902@columbia.edu){target="_blank"}
</div>
</div>
